title: Luke Chapter 9 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Luke chapter 9 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Luke Chapter 9 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Luke Chapter 9.

questions.question: What power did Jesus give to his twelve disciples according to Luke 9:1?
options: Power and authority over all devils and to cure diseases
Power to perform miracles and raise the dead
Power to preach in synagogues only
Power to build churches
questions.correctAnswer: Power and authority over all devils and to cure diseases
questions.explanation: Luke 9:1 states that Jesus gave his twelve disciples power and authority over all devils and to cure diseases.

questions.question: What were the disciples instructed to take on their journey in Luke 9:3?
options: Nothing at all, neither staves, scrip, bread, money, nor two coats
Only bread and water
Money and two coats
Only their staffs
questions.correctAnswer: Nothing at all, neither staves, scrip, bread, money, nor two coats
questions.explanation: Luke 9:3 instructs the disciples to take nothing for their journey, neither staves, scrip, bread, money, nor two coats each.

questions.question: What should the disciples do if a house they visit does not receive them, according to Luke 9:5?
options: Shake off the dust from their feet as testimony against that house
Pray for the household
Stay and preach longer
Ignore and move on silently
questions.correctAnswer: Shake off the dust from their feet as testimony against that house
questions.explanation: In Luke 9:5, Jesus tells the disciples to shake off the dust from their feet as a testimony against those who do not receive them.

questions.question: Who was perplexed because of the reports about Jesus, as mentioned in Luke 9:7?
options: Herod the tetrarch
Pontius Pilate
Caesar Augustus
Nicodemus
questions.correctAnswer: Herod the tetrarch
questions.explanation: Luke 9:7 tells us that Herod the tetrarch heard of all that Jesus did and was perplexed by the reports.

questions.question: How many men were present when Jesus fed the five thousand, according to Luke 9:14?
options: About five thousand men
About three thousand men
About one thousand men
About ten thousand men
questions.correctAnswer: About five thousand men
questions.explanation: Luke 9:14 states that there were about five thousand men present at the feeding of the five loaves and two fishes.

questions.question: Who answered Jesus saying, 'The Christ of God' when asked who He was in Luke 9:20?
options: Peter
John
James
Andrew
questions.correctAnswer: Peter
questions.explanation: In Luke 9:20, Peter answers Jesus' question by saying, 'The Christ of God.'

questions.question: What must a person do to follow Jesus according to Luke 9:23?
options: Deny himself, take up his cross daily, and follow Jesus
Give all possessions to the poor
Only believe in Jesus without action
Become a teacher of the law
questions.correctAnswer: Deny himself, take up his cross daily, and follow Jesus
questions.explanation: Luke 9:23 records Jesus saying that anyone who wants to follow Him must deny themselves, take up their cross daily, and follow Him.

questions.question: On the mountain, who appeared and talked with Jesus in Luke 9:30?
options: Moses and Elias
Peter and John
Elijah and Jeremiah
Abraham and Isaac
questions.correctAnswer: Moses and Elias
questions.explanation: Luke 9:30 states that Moses and Elias appeared and talked with Jesus on the mountain.

questions.question: What did the voice from the cloud say in Luke 9:35?
options: "This is my beloved Son: hear him."
"This is my chosen prophet: obey him."
"This is the King of Israel: follow him."
"This is the Messiah: worship him."
questions.correctAnswer: "This is my beloved Son: hear him."
questions.explanation: Luke 9:35 records the voice from the cloud saying, 'This is my beloved Son: hear him.'

questions.question: What did Jesus say about those who are ashamed of Him and His words in Luke 9:26?
options: The Son of man will be ashamed of them when He comes in glory
They will be forgiven
They will be exalted
They will be blessed
questions.correctAnswer: The Son of man will be ashamed of them when He comes in glory
questions.explanation: Luke 9:26 explains that whoever is ashamed of Jesus and His words, the Son of man will be ashamed of when He comes in His glory.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus told His disciples to forbid others who cast out devils in His name but were not with them, according to Luke 9:49-50.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Luke 9:50 records Jesus saying not to forbid those who are not against them, indicating He did not want them to forbid others casting out devils in His name.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus said the Son of man came to destroy men's lives, according to Luke 9:56.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Luke 9:56 clearly states that the Son of man is not come to destroy men's lives, but to save them.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus said, 'No man, having put his hand to the plough, and looking back, is fit for the kingdom of God,' in Luke 9:62.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Luke 9:62 records Jesus saying this exact statement about not looking back after committing to follow Him.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to Luke 9:58, Jesus said, 'Foxes have holes, and birds of the air have nests; but the Son of man hath not where to lay his ______.'
options: head
hand
foot
cloak
questions.correctAnswer: head
questions.explanation: Luke 9:58 states that the Son of man has not where to lay his head, highlighting His lack of earthly home.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: In Luke 9:17, after Jesus fed the five thousand, there were twelve baskets of ______ taken up from the fragments.
options: fragments
fish
loaves
bread
questions.correctAnswer: fragments
questions.explanation: Luke 9:17 mentions that twelve baskets of fragments were taken up after everyone ate and was filled.

medium.title: Luke Chapter 9 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Luke Chapter 9 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Luke 9 teach us about trusting God when facing challenges in evangelism?
options: Take nothing for your journey and rely on God's provision
Always carry plenty of food and money for safety
Avoid going into towns that might reject you
Only preach where you are guaranteed hospitality
questions.correctAnswer: Take nothing for your journey and rely on God's provision
questions.explanation: In Luke 9:3, Jesus instructs the disciples to take nothing for their journey, emphasizing reliance on God's provision rather than material security. This teaches faith and trust in God when sharing the Gospel.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with pride and wants to know how to live humbly according to Luke 9. What biblical truth would you share?
options: The one who is least among you all shall be greatest
Always seek the highest position in the church
Show your status to gain respect
Avoid associating with children or those considered weak
questions.correctAnswer: The one who is least among you all shall be greatest
questions.explanation: Luke 9:48 teaches that receiving a child in Jesus' name is receiving Him, and that the least will be great. This highlights humility and valuing others as keys to greatness in God's kingdom.

questions.question: What does Luke 9 say about perseverance in trials and suffering for Christ?
options: The Son of man must suffer many things and be rejected, but will rise again
Followers of Christ will avoid suffering if they are faithful
Suffering is a sign of God's displeasure
Only apostles are called to suffer for Christ
questions.correctAnswer: The Son of man must suffer many things and be rejected, but will rise again
questions.explanation: Luke 9:22 reveals Jesus' prediction of His suffering, rejection, death, and resurrection, teaching believers to expect trials but also the hope of victory through Christ.

questions.question: How does Luke 9 encourage prayer and dependence on God in personal devotion?
options: Jesus went up to pray alone, and His appearance was transformed
Prayer is unnecessary if you work hard
Only public prayers are valuable
Prayer should be done only in the synagogue
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus went up to pray alone, and His appearance was transformed
questions.explanation: Luke 9:28-29 shows Jesus praying alone on a mountain and His countenance changing, emphasizing the importance of solitary prayer and dependence on God for spiritual strength.

questions.question: A believer is concerned about humility in service. What teaching from Luke 9 can help them?
options: Whoever receives a child in Jesus' name receives Him and God the Father
Only those with authority should serve
Service is only for the spiritually gifted
Greatness comes from worldly success
questions.correctAnswer: Whoever receives a child in Jesus' name receives Him and God the Father
questions.explanation: Luke 9:48 explains that welcoming the least (like a child) is equivalent to receiving Jesus and God, encouraging humble and loving service to all.

questions.question: How does Luke 9 guide us in responding to rejection when sharing the Gospel?
options: Shake off the dust from your feet as a testimony against those who reject you
Get angry and confront them aggressively
Stop sharing the Gospel in that area permanently
Ignore their rejection and force your message
questions.correctAnswer: Shake off the dust from your feet as a testimony against those who reject you
questions.explanation: Luke 9:5 instructs the disciples to shake off the dust from their feet when rejected, symbolizing separation and testimony but continuing their mission without bitterness.

questions.question: What does Luke 9 teach about generosity and stewardship in caring for others?
options: Jesus fed five thousand people with five loaves and two fishes
Only the wealthy should provide food for the needy
Sharing resources is unnecessary if the need is too large
It is better to send people away to fend for themselves
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus fed five thousand people with five loaves and two fishes
questions.explanation: Luke 9:13-17 shows Jesus multiplying a small offering to feed thousands, teaching that God blesses generous giving and caring for others' needs.

questions.question: True or False: According to Luke 9, Jesus encouraged His disciples to forbid others casting out demons in His name if they were not part of their group.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Luke 9:49-50 records Jesus telling John not to forbid someone casting out demons in His name even though he was not part of their group, emphasizing unity and support in ministry.

questions.question: How does Luke 9 instruct believers about following Christ despite personal cost?
options: Deny yourself, take up your cross daily, and follow Jesus
Follow Jesus only when life is easy
Prioritize family obligations above discipleship
Wait until you have security before following
questions.correctAnswer: Deny yourself, take up your cross daily, and follow Jesus
questions.explanation: Luke 9:23 teaches that true discipleship involves daily self-denial and willingness to endure suffering for Christ, emphasizing commitment and perseverance.

questions.question: A believer is hesitant to start ministry because they feel unprepared. What encouragement does Luke 9 offer?
options: Jesus gave His disciples power and authority to heal and cast out demons
Only experienced leaders can minister effectively
Ministry should be delayed until full training is complete
Success depends solely on human effort
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus gave His disciples power and authority to heal and cast out demons
questions.explanation: Luke 9:1-2 shows Jesus empowering His disciples to preach, heal, and cast out demons, encouraging believers to trust God’s enabling in ministry.

questions.question: True or False: Luke 9 teaches that looking back or hesitating after committing to follow Christ makes a person unfit for the kingdom of God.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: In Luke 9:62, Jesus says that no one who looks back after putting their hand to the plough is fit for the kingdom, emphasizing wholehearted commitment.

questions.question: How does Luke 9 instruct believers regarding anger and retaliation when facing opposition?
options: Jesus rebuked His disciples for wanting to call fire down on the Samaritan village
Jesus encouraged retaliation and judgment against enemies
Believers should use force to defend themselves
Ignoring opposition is cowardice
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus rebuked His disciples for wanting to call fire down on the Samaritan village
questions.explanation: Luke 9:54-55 records Jesus rebuking James and John when they wanted to call fire from heaven on Samaritans, teaching restraint, mercy, and the purpose of salvation.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with fear of rejection for their faith. What assurance does Luke 9 provide?
options: Whoever is ashamed of Jesus and His words will be ashamed by Him at His coming
Rejection means God has abandoned you
Faithful believers will never face shame
Avoid confessing Christ to prevent rejection
questions.correctAnswer: Whoever is ashamed of Jesus and His words will be ashamed by Him at His coming
questions.explanation: Luke 9:26 warns that those ashamed of Jesus will face shame at His return, encouraging believers to boldly confess their faith despite opposition.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Jesus said, 'Let the dead bury their dead: but go thou and ______ the kingdom of God.'
options: preach
destroy
ignore
avoid
questions.correctAnswer: preach
questions.explanation: Luke 9:60 records Jesus emphasizing the urgency of proclaiming God's kingdom over earthly obligations, teaching commitment to God's mission.

questions.question: How does Luke 9 demonstrate the importance of faith when Jesus healed the boy with the unclean spirit?
options: Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit and healed the boy after the father showed faith
The disciples healed the boy without Jesus’ help
Faith was unnecessary for the healing
Jesus healed only because the boy was famous
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit and healed the boy after the father showed faith
questions.explanation: Luke 9:41-42 shows Jesus responding to the faithless generation and healing the boy, teaching dependence on God’s power and the importance of faith in healing.

hard.title: Luke Chapter 9 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Luke Chapter 9.

questions.question: In Luke 9, what authority did Jesus give to his twelve disciples?
options: Power over all devils and to cure diseases
Authority to build synagogues
Power to baptize with the Holy Spirit
Authority to write scripture
questions.correctAnswer: Power over all devils and to cure diseases
questions.explanation: Luke 9:1 explicitly states that Jesus gave his twelve disciples power and authority over all devils and to cure diseases, underscoring their mission to combat spiritual and physical ailments.

questions.question: What instruction did Jesus give the disciples regarding what to take on their journey?
options: Take nothing, neither staves, nor scrip, nor bread, nor money, nor two coats
Take only bread and wine for communion
Take weapons for self-defense
Take gold and silver for offerings
questions.correctAnswer: Take nothing, neither staves, nor scrip, nor bread, nor money, nor two coats
questions.explanation: Luke 9:3 records Jesus instructing the disciples to take nothing for their journey, emphasizing reliance on God's provision and hospitality of others, a practice resonant with prophetic traditions.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus feeding the five thousand with five loaves and two fishes in Luke 9?
options: It foreshadows the Last Supper and Eucharist
It shows Jesus' ability to multiply wealth
It signifies the disciples’ independence
It represents a political revolution
questions.correctAnswer: It foreshadows the Last Supper and Eucharist
questions.explanation: The miracle in Luke 9:16-17, where Jesus blesses, breaks, and distributes loaves and fishes, alludes typologically to the Last Supper, highlighting Jesus as the provider of spiritual nourishment.

questions.question: Who did the people say Jesus was, according to Luke 9?
options: John the Baptist, Elias, or one of the old prophets risen again
Moses, Elijah, or Jeremiah
A new king, a Roman official, or a miracle worker
An angel, a rabbi, or a carpenter
questions.correctAnswer: John the Baptist, Elias, or one of the old prophets risen again
questions.explanation: Luke 9:18-19 records various public opinions about Jesus' identity, reflecting Jewish expectations of prophetic figures and messianic hope rooted in Old Testament typology.

questions.question: What was Peter's confession about Jesus' identity?
options: The Christ of God
The Son of David
A prophet like Elijah
The Son of Joseph
questions.correctAnswer: The Christ of God
questions.explanation: In Luke 9:20, Peter acknowledges Jesus as 'The Christ of God,' a pivotal messianic confession that identifies Jesus as the anointed one promised in Hebrew Scriptures.

questions.question: What does Jesus mean when he says, 'take up his cross daily, and follow me'?
options: To embrace self-denial and suffer for the sake of discipleship
To physically carry a cross to the temple daily
To participate in Roman executions
To preach publicly every day
questions.correctAnswer: To embrace self-denial and suffer for the sake of discipleship
questions.explanation: Luke 9:23 uses the cross metaphor to illustrate the cost of discipleship, connecting Jesus' imminent passion with the call for his followers to embrace sacrifice and obedience.

questions.question: What literary device is evident when Jesus commands the people to sit in groups of fifty during the feeding of the five thousand?
options: Chiastic structure to organize the crowd
Paronomasia to create wordplay
Allegory representing tribes of Israel
Hyperbole to exaggerate numbers
questions.correctAnswer: Chiastic structure to organize the crowd
questions.explanation: Though subtle, the arrangement of people into groups of fifty (Luke 9:14-15) reflects a chiastic structuring technique to impose order and emphasize communal unity during the miracle.

questions.question: What is the significance of the Transfiguration event in Luke 9:28-36?
options: It reveals Jesus' divine glory and fulfills Old Testament prophecy
It is a parable about humility
It marks the beginning of Jesus’ ministry
It is a vision experienced only by Peter
questions.correctAnswer: It reveals Jesus' divine glory and fulfills Old Testament prophecy
questions.explanation: The Transfiguration (Luke 9:29-36) is a theophanic moment where Jesus' divine nature is revealed, Moses and Elijah represent the Law and Prophets, linking Jesus' mission to Israel’s sacred history.

questions.question: Which two Old Testament figures appeared with Jesus during the Transfiguration?
options: Moses and Elias (Elijah)
Abraham and Isaac
David and Solomon
Isaiah and Jeremiah
questions.correctAnswer: Moses and Elias (Elijah)
questions.explanation: Luke 9:30 identifies Moses and Elias (Elijah) appearing with Jesus, symbolizing the Law and the Prophets and underscoring Jesus as the fulfillment of both.

questions.question: What command did God give from the cloud during the Transfiguration?
options: "This is my beloved Son: hear him."
"Do not fear any man."
"Go and make disciples of all nations."
"The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want."
questions.correctAnswer: "This is my beloved Son: hear him."
questions.explanation: Luke 9:35 records the divine voice affirming Jesus’ identity as God's beloved Son and commanding the disciples to listen to him, highlighting his authority.

questions.question: What was Jesus’ response when his disciples wanted to call down fire on the Samaritans who rejected him?
options: He rebuked them, saying they did not know what manner of spirit they were of
He agreed and called fire from heaven
He ignored their request
He sent them to another village to retaliate
questions.correctAnswer: He rebuked them, saying they did not know what manner of spirit they were of
questions.explanation: Luke 9:55 shows Jesus correcting his disciples’ zealous but misguided desire for vengeance, emphasizing his mission to save, not destroy, lives.

questions.question: According to Luke 9, what does Jesus say about those who are ashamed of him and his words?
options: The Son of man will be ashamed of them when he comes in his glory
They will be forgiven if they repent
They will be exalted by God
They will live eternally in the Promised Land
questions.correctAnswer: The Son of man will be ashamed of them when he comes in his glory
questions.explanation: Luke 9:26 teaches that being ashamed of Jesus results in Jesus being ashamed of that person at his glorious coming, indicating the seriousness of public confession of faith.

questions.question: What does Jesus teach about greatness among his followers in Luke 9?
options: Whoever is least among you all is the greatest
Greatness is achieved by wealth and power
Only the eldest disciple is great
Greatness comes from winning debates
questions.correctAnswer: Whoever is least among you all is the greatest
questions.explanation: In Luke 9:48, Jesus teaches a radical inversion of social status, using a child as a symbol of humility and the kingdom’s values to redefine greatness among his followers.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus allowed only his twelve disciples to cast out demons in his name.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Luke 9:49-50 indicates that Jesus told John not to forbid someone casting out demons in Jesus’ name even though he was not part of their group, showing inclusivity in the ministry.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Jesus said, 'No man, having put his hand to the plough, and looking back, is fit for the ______.'
options: kingdom of God
synagogue
temple service
holy city
questions.correctAnswer: kingdom of God
questions.explanation: Luke 9:62 uses the agricultural metaphor of ploughing to stress the necessity of single-minded commitment to the kingdom of God without hesitation or regret.

theological.title: Luke Chapter 9 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Luke Chapter 9 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What authority did Jesus give to His twelve disciples according to Luke 9:1?
options: Power over all devils and to cure diseases
Authority to build churches
Power to write scripture
Authority to judge Israel
questions.correctAnswer: Power over all devils and to cure diseases
questions.explanation: Luke 9:1 states Jesus gave His disciples power over all devils and to cure diseases, demonstrating His granting of spiritual authority and healing power, which aligns with Old Testament themes of God's authority over evil (Exodus 7:1-2) and healing (Isaiah 53:4-5).

questions.question: What did Jesus instruct the disciples to take on their journey as recorded in Luke 9:3?
options: Nothing, neither staves, nor scrip, nor bread, nor money, nor two coats
Gold, silver, and fine linen
Weapons and armor for protection
Food and money for provision
questions.correctAnswer: Nothing, neither staves, nor scrip, nor bread, nor money, nor two coats
questions.explanation: Luke 9:3 specifically commands the disciples to take nothing for their journey, emphasizing reliance on God's provision, a theme echoed in Matthew 10:9-10 and reflected in Deuteronomy 8:3 about dependence on God's word over material provision.

questions.question: How did Jesus respond when the disciples said they only had five loaves and two fishes to feed about five thousand men (Luke 9:13-14)?
options: He told them to give the people something to eat
He told them to send the people away to buy food
He said to pray for more food
He ignored their concern
questions.correctAnswer: He told them to give the people something to eat
questions.explanation: Luke 9:13 shows Jesus instructing the disciples to feed the multitude despite limited resources, illustrating divine provision and the Messianic role as provider, consistent with Old Testament miracles like Elisha feeding 100 men (2 Kings 4:42-44) and God’s provision of manna (Exodus 16).

questions.question: Who did Peter confess Jesus to be in Luke 9:20?
options: The Christ of God
John the Baptist
Elias
One of the old prophets risen again
questions.correctAnswer: The Christ of God
questions.explanation: Peter’s confession in Luke 9:20 identifies Jesus as the Messiah ('Christ'), a central Christological confession rooted in Old Testament expectations of the Anointed One (Psalm 2:2; Isaiah 9:6-7) and affirmed throughout the New Testament (John 1:41; Acts 2:36).

questions.question: What did Jesus say must happen to the Son of Man according to Luke 9:22?
options: He must suffer, be rejected, be killed, and be raised on the third day
He must conquer all nations by force
He will reign immediately over Israel
He will not suffer but only teach
questions.correctAnswer: He must suffer, be rejected, be killed, and be raised on the third day
questions.explanation: Luke 9:22 outlines the necessary passion, death, and resurrection of Jesus, fulfilling messianic predictions (Isaiah 53:3-10; Psalm 16:10) and establishing the foundation of Christian soteriology regarding atonement and resurrection (1 Corinthians 15:3-4).

questions.question: According to Luke 9:23, what must a person do to follow Jesus?
options: Deny himself, take up his cross daily, and follow Jesus
Become wealthy and powerful
Perform many miracles
Preach loudly in public places
questions.correctAnswer: Deny himself, take up his cross daily, and follow Jesus
questions.explanation: Luke 9:23 teaches discipleship involves self-denial and daily commitment to Jesus, symbolized by the cross which represents suffering and sacrifice, aligning with Pauline teachings on dying to self (Galatians 2:20; Romans 12:1-2) and the cost of discipleship (Matthew 16:24).

questions.question: What did Jesus say about gaining the whole world but losing oneself in Luke 9:25?
options: It is a great loss to gain the world but lose oneself
It is wise to gain the world at any cost
Losing oneself is not important
Gaining the world guarantees salvation
questions.correctAnswer: It is a great loss to gain the world but lose oneself
questions.explanation: Luke 9:25 warns that worldly gain is worthless if it costs a person’s soul, emphasizing eternal value over temporal gain, consistent with Jesus' teachings (Matthew 16:26) and Old Testament wisdom literature that values the soul above riches (Proverbs 11:4).

questions.question: In Luke 9:27, what promise did Jesus make about some standing there?
options: They will not taste death before seeing the kingdom of God
They will immediately enter heaven
They will never suffer
They will be kings in Israel
questions.correctAnswer: They will not taste death before seeing the kingdom of God
questions.explanation: Luke 9:27 promises some present will witness the kingdom of God before dying, interpreted as a reference to the Transfiguration (Luke 9:28-36), the resurrection, or Pentecost, paralleling Old Testament visions of God’s kingdom (Daniel 7:13-14) and fulfilled in the New Testament (Acts 2).

questions.question: Who appeared with Jesus during the Transfiguration as described in Luke 9:30-31?
options: Moses and Elias
Peter and John
Elijah and John the Baptist
David and Isaiah
questions.correctAnswer: Moses and Elias
questions.explanation: Luke 9:30-31 recounts Moses and Elijah (Elias) appearing and speaking with Jesus, symbolizing the Law and the Prophets testifying to Jesus’ mission, consistent with Old Testament typology (Deuteronomy 18:15; Malachi 4:5) and New Testament fulfillment (Hebrews 3:1-6).

questions.question: What did the voice from the cloud say during the Transfiguration in Luke 9:35?
options: This is my beloved Son: hear him
This is my servant: obey him
This is the prophet: follow him
This is my chosen one: honor him
questions.correctAnswer: This is my beloved Son: hear him
questions.explanation: Luke 9:35 records God's affirmation of Jesus as His beloved Son, commanding the disciples to listen to Him, echoing Old Testament divine proclamations (Psalm 2:7; Isaiah 42:1) and affirming Jesus’ unique Sonship and authority (Matthew 3:17; John 12:28).

questions.question: What was Jesus’ reaction to the disciples’ desire to call down fire on the Samaritan village (Luke 9:54-55)?
options: He rebuked them, saying they did not know what spirit they were of
He commanded fire to come down immediately
He ignored their request
He praised their zeal
questions.correctAnswer: He rebuked them, saying they did not know what spirit they were of
questions.explanation: In Luke 9:55, Jesus rebukes James and John for their vengeful spirit, emphasizing His mission to save rather than destroy lives, reflecting God's mercy (Jonah 4:2), Jesus' mission of redemption (Luke 19:10), and the New Testament ethic of love and forgiveness (Romans 12:17-21).

questions.question: What did Jesus say to the man who wanted to follow Him but first asked to bury his father (Luke 9:59-60)?
options: Let the dead bury their dead, but go and preach the kingdom of God
Wait until you bury your father
Follow me after a year
It is acceptable to delay following
questions.correctAnswer: Let the dead bury their dead, but go and preach the kingdom of God
questions.explanation: Luke 9:60 shows Jesus calling for radical commitment, prioritizing the kingdom of God above traditional duties, paralleling Old Testament calls to urgent obedience (Isaiah 55:6) and New Testament urgency in discipleship (Matthew 8:21-22).

questions.question: According to Luke 9:62, what does Jesus say about one who looks back after putting his hand to the plough?
options: He is not fit for the kingdom of God
He will succeed eventually
He should plough backwards
He is wise to reconsider
questions.correctAnswer: He is not fit for the kingdom of God
questions.explanation: Luke 9:62 teaches that wholehearted, undivided commitment is essential for the kingdom of God, echoing Old Testament calls for faithfulness (Joshua 24:15) and New Testament teachings on perseverance in faith (Hebrews 12:1-2).

questions.question: What was the reaction of the people when Jesus healed the boy possessed by a spirit in Luke 9:42-43?
options: They were amazed at the mighty power of God
They doubted Jesus' power
They ignored the miracle
They asked for money
questions.correctAnswer: They were amazed at the mighty power of God
questions.explanation: Luke 9:43 shows the crowd’s amazement at God’s power displayed through Jesus’ healing, affirming His divine authority and fulfilling Old Testament expectations of God’s miraculous intervention (Exodus 15:11; Isaiah 35:5-6).

questions.question: How did Jesus describe those who are ashamed of Him and His words in Luke 9:26?
options: The Son of Man will be ashamed of them when He comes in glory
They will be praised by men
They will be immediately forgiven
They will be exalted in the kingdom
questions.correctAnswer: The Son of Man will be ashamed of them when He comes in glory
questions.explanation: Luke 9:26 warns of eschatological judgment for those ashamed of Christ, consistent with biblical teaching on confession and denial (Romans 10:9-11; Matthew 10:32-33) and the ultimate revelation of Christ’s glory (Revelation 1:7).
